definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]

sentences.english: The error of magnetic compass is not adjusted.
sentences.chinese: 磁罗经的误差没有校正。

sentences.english: Take celestial azimuth and find compass error on each watch if the weather is fine.
sentences.chinese: 如天气好，每一班测取天体方位求出罗经差。

sentences.english: Don't look too much at the compass. Get a good mark on shore.
sentences.chinese: 不要总看罗经，要找出岸上显著物标。

sentences.english: Check Gyro and Magnetic courses frequently.
sentences.chinese: 经常核对陀螺罗经和磁罗经航向。

sentences.english: Check Gyro and Magnetic courses frequently.
sentences.chinese: 经常核对陀螺罗经和磁罗经航向。

sentences.english: Application of fuzzy control in platform gyrocompass is studied.
sentences.chinese: 平台罗经模糊控制的应用研究。

sentences.english: The gyro isn't up to standard. Please give us a certificate so that we can make a claim on the shipyard.
sentences.chinese: 罗经达不到标准，请给我们出具证明以便向船厂索赔。

sentences.english: Calibration constant error and function for gyro-compass on sea trial.
sentences.chinese: 航行试验中电罗经固定误差校正和效用试验。

sentences.english: She is equipped with a gyrocompass.
A new type of computer control system for platform gyrocompass is designed and realized.
sentences.chinese: 新型平台罗经计算机控制系统的设计和实现。

sentences.english: The course indication of repeaters does not match that of gyro compass.
sentences.chinese: 主罗经和分罗经航向示度不匹配。

sentences.english: The course indication of repeaters does not match that of gyro compass.
sentences.chinese: 主罗经和分罗经航向示度不匹配。

definition: Liuchia township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to concentrate/to think what you're doing
sun, moon and the five visible planets

four divisions (of the twenty-eight constellations 二十八宿[er4 shi2 ba1 xiu4] of the sky into groups of seven mansions), namely: Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2], White Tiger 白虎[Bai2 hu3], Vermilion Bird 朱雀[Zhu1 que4], Black Tortoise 玄武[Xuan2 wu3]
delta Ursae Majoris in the Big Dipper
mystery known only to heaven (archaic)/inscrutable twist of fate/fig. top secret
constellation (arch., now 星座)/one of the 28 constellations of traditional Chinese astronomy and astrology/motion of stars since one's birth (predetermining one's fate in astrology)
the seven planets of premodern astronomy (the Sun, the Moon, Mercury, Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn)
to divine/to prophecy/to foretell the future
